title: Consanguinity Disruptus: The Phenomenology of Incest as Limit Experience
description: Consanguinity Disruptus explores the phenomenological lived experience of the incested that has been hidden away under the label “unmentionable”. Those in contact with the effects of incest personally or peripherally may use it as a guide to supplement educational, familial, and therapeutic environments. More important, a shift in psychological and social context is the aim for readers.
author: Auguste Hill
